alert.note: Alert for Coosa; Elmore (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 12:35PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Elmore and southern Coosa Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1235 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Speed, or 7 miles south of Rockford, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rockford, Equality, Speed, Lyle, Pentonville, Cottage Grove, Titus, Highway 9 and Highway 22, Welona, Nixburg, Crewsville, Western Lake Martin, Fishpond, Ray and Hissop. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
